quote: Man's nature is not essentially evil. Brute nature has been know to yield to the influence of love. You must never despair of human nature.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
author: Gerard De Nerval

quote: The earth has music for those who listen.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nature is full of infinite causes that have never occurred in experience.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Law is born from despair of human nature.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Nature is just enough; but men and women must comprehend and accept her suggestions.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Human nature is evil, and goodness is caused by intentional activity.
author: Xun Zi

quote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: For greed all nature is too little.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Human nature is potentially aggressive and destructive and potentially orderly and constructive.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Nothing is more memorable than a smell. One scent can be unexpected, momentary and fleeting, yet conjure up a childhood summer beside a lake in the mountains.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: The human spirit needs places where nature has not been rearranged by the hand of man.
author: Author

quote: The moral virtues, then, are produced in us neither by nature nor against nature. Nature, indeed, prepares in us the ground for their reception, but their complete formation is the product of habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: Let a hundred flowers bloom, let a hundred schools of thought contend.
author: Mao Zedong

quote: Self-preservation is the first law of nature.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Nature is so powerful, so strong. Capturing its essence is not easy - your work becomes a dance with light and the weather. It takes you to a place within yourself.
author: Annie Leibovitz

quote: There are three principal means of acquiring knowledge... observation of nature, reflection, and experimentation. Observation collects facts; reflection combines them; experimentation verifies the result of that combination.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Nature gives to every time and season some beauties of its own; and from morning to night, as from the cradle to the grave, it is but a succession of changes so gentle and easy that we can scarcely mark their progress.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: If we kill off the wild then we are killing a part of our souls.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: It is human nature to think wisely and act in an absurd fashion.
author: Anatole France

quote: The evolution of human mentality has put us all in vitro now behind the glass wall of our own ingenuity.
author: John Fowles

quote: Nature teaches more than she preaches. There are no sermons in stones. It is easier to get a spark out of a stone than a moral.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Nature holds the key to our aesthetic, intellectual, cognitive and even spiritual satisfaction.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Be truthful, nature only sides with truth.
author: Adolf Loos

quote: It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: God and Nature first made us what we are, and then out of our own created genius we make ourselves what we want to be. Follow always that great law. Let the sky and God be our limit and Eternity our measurement.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: If journalism is good, it is controversial, by its nature.
author: Julian Assange

quote: There is no God, Nature sufficeth unto herself; in no wise hath she need of an author.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: The true way to be humble is not to stoop until you are smaller than yourself, but to stand at your real height against some higher nature that will show you what the real smallness of your greatness is.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: A good river is natures life work in song.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: A desire to resist oppression is implanted in the nature of man.
author: Tacitus

quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: I look upon all creatures equally; none are less dear to me and none more dear. But those who worship me with love live in me, and I come to life in them.
author: Bhagavad Gita

quote: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The diversity of the phenomena of nature is so great, and the treasures hidden in the heavens so rich, precisely in order that the human mind shall never be lacking in fresh nourishment.
author: Johannes Kepler

quote: For in the true nature of things, if we rightly consider, every green tree is far more glorious than if it were made of gold and silver.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The lake and the mountains have become my landscape, my real world.
author: Georges Simenon

quote: There are no lines in nature, only areas of colour, one against another.
author: Edouard Manet

quote: Self-defence is Nature's eldest law.
author: John Dryden

quote: How strange that nature does not knock, and yet does not intrude!
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Zoos are becoming facsimiles - or perhaps caricatures - of how animals once were in their natural habitat. If the right policies toward nature were pursued, we would need no zoos at all.
author: Michael J. Fox

quote: Come forth into the light of things, let nature be your teacher.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: I think it's a very firm part of human nature that if you surround yourself with like-minded people, you'll end up thinking more extreme versions of what you thought before.
author: Cass Sunstein

quote: Nature goes her own way and all that to us seems an exception is really according to order.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: A light wind swept over the corn, and all nature laughed in the sunshine.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: We must make it an imperative duty of our government to protect the gifts which Nature has bestowed on America and to insure the maintenance of a clean, healthy, wholesome environment for our people.
author: George Lincoln Rockwell

quote: The sun will set without thy assistance.
author: The Talmud

quote: To insult someone we call him bestial. For deliberate cruelty and nature, human might be the greater insult.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Joy in looking and comprehending is nature's most beautiful gift.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science is a perception of the world around us. Science is a place where what you find in nature pleases you.
author: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar

quote: Handle a book as a bee does a flower extract its sweetness but do not damage it.
author: John Muir

quote: As human beings, we are endowed with freedom of choice, and we cannot shuffle off our responsibility upon the shoulders of God or nature. We must shoulder it ourselves. It is our responsibility.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: Miracles do not, in fact, break the laws of nature.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

quote: Speech is human nature itself, with none of the artificiality of written language.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Nature uses as little as possible of anything.
author: Johannes Kepler

quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head, and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away the hunger.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The most general law in nature is equity-the principle of balance and symmetry which guides the growth of forms along the lines of the greatest structural efficiency.
author: Herbert Read

quote: All water has a perfect memory and is forever trying to get back to where it was.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: By nature all men are equal in liberty, but not in other endowments.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Only nature knows how to justly proportion to the fault the punishment it deserves.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: In general, mankind, since the improvement of cookery, eats twice as much as nature requires.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: What we observe is not nature itself, but nature exposed to our method of questioning.
author: Werner Heisenberg

quote: Nature, to be commanded, must be obeyed.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: There are moments when all anxiety and stated toil are becalmed in the infinite leisure and repose of nature.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
author: Aristotle

quote: Nature is not only all that is visible to the eye... it also includes the inner pictures of the soul.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man's nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Nature is an endless combination and repetition of a very few laws. She hums the old well-known air through innumerable variations.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nature, by its very nature, is very brutal and unequal. However, Man has somehow managed to transform the nature of its brutality and inequality.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: Nature has never read the Declaration of Independence. It continues to make us unequal.
author: Will Durant

quote: Man has demonstrated that he is master of everything except his own nature.
author: Henry Miller

quote: And then there are the times when the wolves are silent and the moon is howling.
author: George Carlin

quote: Nature always tends to act in the simplest way.
author: Bernoulli

quote: The primary and most beautiful of Nature's qualities is motion, which agitates her at all times, but this motion is simply a perpetual consequence of crimes, she conserves it by means of crimes only.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: No sight is more provocative of awe than is the night sky.
author: Llewelyn Powys

quote: Nature and nature's laws lay hid in the night. God said, Let Newton be! and all was light!
author: Alexander Pope

quote: We are all full of weakness and errors; let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.
author: Voltaire

quote: Into each life some rain must fall, some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The stars, that nature hung in heaven, and filled their lamps with everlasting oil, give due light to the misled and lonely traveller.
author: John Milton

quote: If only nature is real and if, in nature, only desire and destruction are legitimate, then, in that all humanity does not suffice to assuage the thirst for blood, the path of destruction must lead to universal annihilation.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Sail! quoth the king; Hold! saith the wind.
author: English Proverb

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: If you live according to the dictates of nature, you will never be poor; if according to the notions of man, you will never be rich.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this; and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Nature... She pardons no mistakes. Her yea is yea, and her nay, nay.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Fear not, we are of the nature of the lion, and cannot descend to the destruction of mice and such small beasts.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: Nature provides exceptions to every rule.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: We must make it an imperative duty of our government to protect the gifts which Nature has bestowed on America and to insure the maintenance of a clean, healthy, wholesome environment for our people.
author: George Lincoln Rockwell

quote: The sun will set without thy assistance.
author: The Talmud

author: Isaac Asimov

author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: If you live according to the dictates of nature, you will never be poor; if according to the notions of man, you will never be rich.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this; and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Nature... She pardons no mistakes. Her yea is yea, and her nay, nay.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Fear not, we are of the nature of the lion, and cannot descend to the destruction of mice and such small beasts.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: Nature provides exceptions to every rule.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: We must make it an imperative duty of our government to protect the gifts which Nature has bestowed on America and to insure the maintenance of a clean, healthy, wholesome environment for our people.
author: George Lincoln Rockwell

quote: The sun will set without thy assistance.
author: The Talmud

quote: To insult someone we call him bestial. For deliberate cruelty and nature, human might be the greater insult.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Joy in looking and comprehending is nature's most beautiful gift.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science is a perception of the world around us. Science is a place where what you find in nature pleases you.
author: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar

quote: Handle a book as a bee does a flower extract its sweetness but do not damage it.
author: John Muir

quote: As human beings, we are endowed with freedom of choice, and we cannot shuffle off our responsibility upon the shoulders of God or nature. We must shoulder it ourselves. It is our responsibility.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: Miracles do not, in fact, break the laws of nature.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

quote: Speech is human nature itself, with none of the artificiality of written language.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Nature uses as little as possible of anything.
author: Johannes Kepler

quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head, and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away the hunger.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The most general law in nature is equity-the principle of balance and symmetry which guides the growth of forms along the lines of the greatest structural efficiency.
author: Herbert Read

quote: All water has a perfect memory and is forever trying to get back to where it was.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: By nature all men are equal in liberty, but not in other endowments.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Only nature knows how to justly proportion to the fault the punishment it deserves.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: In general, mankind, since the improvement of cookery, eats twice as much as nature requires.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: What we observe is not nature itself, but nature exposed to our method of questioning.
author: Werner Heisenberg

quote: Nature, to be commanded, must be obeyed.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: There are moments when all anxiety and stated toil are becalmed in the infinite leisure and repose of nature.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
author: Aristotle

quote: Nature is not only all that is visible to the eye... it also includes the inner pictures of the soul.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man's nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Nature is an endless combination and repetition of a very few laws. She hums the old well-known air through innumerable variations.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nature, by its very nature, is very brutal and unequal. However, Man has somehow managed to transform the nature of its brutality and inequality.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: Nature has never read the Declaration of Independence. It continues to make us unequal.
author: Will Durant

quote: Man has demonstrated that he is master of everything except his own nature.
author: Henry Miller

quote: And then there are the times when the wolves are silent and the moon is howling.
author: George Carlin

quote: Nature always tends to act in the simplest way.
author: Bernoulli

quote: The primary and most beautiful of Nature's qualities is motion, which agitates her at all times, but this motion is simply a perpetual consequence of crimes, she conserves it by means of crimes only.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: No sight is more provocative of awe than is the night sky.
author: Llewelyn Powys

quote: Nature and nature's laws lay hid in the night. God said, Let Newton be! and all was light!
author: Alexander Pope

quote: We are all full of weakness and errors; let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.
author: Voltaire

quote: Into each life some rain must fall, some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The stars, that nature hung in heaven, and filled their lamps with everlasting oil, give due light to the misled and lonely traveller.
author: John Milton

quote: If only nature is real and if, in nature, only desire and destruction are legitimate, then, in that all humanity does not suffice to assuage the thirst for blood, the path of destruction must lead to universal annihilation.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Sail! quoth the king; Hold! saith the wind.
author: English Proverb

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: If you live according to the dictates of nature, you will never be poor; if according to the notions of man, you will never be rich.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this; and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Nature... She pardons no mistakes. Her yea is yea, and her nay, nay.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Fear not, we are of the nature of the lion, and cannot descend to the destruction of mice and such small beasts.
author: Elizabeth I

quote: Nature provides exceptions to every rule.
author: Margaret Fuller
